WorkItem.Description:
After "successfully installing" TypeScript 0.9.1.1, it doesn't show up in Tools, Extensions. Add > New Item doesn't show the file type TypeScript. When I attempt to create a .ts file, VS converts it to a .cs file, further validating that TypeScript for VS is not properly installed.

This is on a Windows 7 machine with Visual Studio Professional 2012, 2010, 2008 installed.

I've uninstalled and installed TypeScript to no avail.

Thanks.
WorkItem.Summary: 0.9.1.1 not installed in Visual Studio 2012 Professional update 4

Comments.Message:
Sorry for the false alarm. The template was just hard to find for me. Add, New Item, Search for TypeScript and the file type came up. 

Geeting it to compile was another story. The following page helped https://typescript.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Compile-on-Save
